name: Dasarath G
about: Electronics engineering graduate with a passion for decoding complex systems across multiple domains. With over three years of diverse experience in startups, research labs, and industry, I've spearheaded projects in healthcare, environment, governance, and finance. My expertise spans Full Stack Development, Web3, IoT, Embedded Systems, and AI, allowing me to craft innovative solutions that bridge technological gaps. As a successful freelancer and team leader, I've completed over 10 projects with a 100% satisfaction rate, demonstrating my ability to deliver results in software development, embedded electronics, and robotics. Currently contributing to the future of decentralized collaboration as a Web3 Developer at Globe & Citizen, where I'm helping build the CNC Portal to revolutionize open-source contribution recognition and governance.

experience.title: Web3 Developer
responsibilities: Building the CNC Portal, an innovative platform for crypto-native corporations, focusing on micro-contribution recognition and effective governance tools.

Architecting and implementing full-stack solutions using Vue.js, Tailwind, DaisyUI for frontend, and Node.js with Prisma and PostgreSQL for backend, ensuring seamless user experiences and robust data management.
Driving quality assurance through comprehensive testing with Vitest and Cypress, while maintaining CI/CD pipelines for streamlined development processes.
Developing and optimizing smart contracts using Solidity, and managing a parallel decentralized e-voting system project, showcasing versatility in blockchain applications.

experience.title: Core Contributor
responsibilities: Developing the 'Instant Send App', a self-custodial smart-contract wallet, for seamless stablecoin transfers between Telegram contacts within the scope of the Telegram Messenger
Research and apply Account Abstraction solutions compatible with Telegram MiniApps and Optimize user experience for crypto newcomers, focusing on simplicity and ease of use

experience.title: Lead Engineer
responsibilities: Led the end-to-end development of paceB, a biomedical device for early-stage Parkinson's disease diagnosis, from concept to market-ready solution.
Engineered a high-performance IoT ecosystem using ESP32, AWS, and EMQX broker, achieving a 13-fold improvement in real-time data streaming efficiency with a 250-byte payload.
Designed and implemented a comprehensive healthcare management system integrating patient records, payment processing, and IoT device control using Node.js, Next.js, Razorpay, MySQL, and EMQX broker.
Orchestrated clinical trials, co-authored a technical white paper, filed a patent, and successfully launched the product, marking a significant milestone for the company.

experience.title: Research and Development Intern
responsibilities: Collaborated with Dr. Yeh-Liang Hsu to develop innovative products for assessing the physical and cognitive well-being of aging adults.
Engineered a scalable IoT backend using Go's Gin-Gonic framework, MongoDB, and MariaDB, facilitating efficient user and device management.
Developed and deployed an activity detection dashboard using smart meter data API, successfully rolled out to over 250 customers.
Contributed to feature development in Flutter and conducted thorough debugging and report writing, culminating in a well-received undergraduate thesis.

experience.title: Embedded Software Developer Intern
responsibilities: Completed a comprehensive project on 'Source Meter Control Automation & Complex Device Drivers (CDD)', gaining deep insights into Battery Management Systems (BMS), embedded software development, and isoSPI technology.
Contributed to the development of embedded systems, enhancing skills in low-level programming and hardware integration.
